items.q: The ____ of many different languages helped create Modern English. a. merging b. separation c. similarity d. momentum
During the 15th century, The British seemed to be ____ the rules of English spelling. a. very concerned about b. indifferent to c. happy about d. carried away with

English typesetters in 15th century England ____. a. made sure all English words were spelled consistently the same b. changed the spelling of words whenever they wanted to c. made sure to always spell Shakespeare name only one way d. always used a dictionary to check their spelling

Which statement is not true about English spelling? a. People in 15th century England spelled their names more than one way. b. Pronunciation of words changed too fast to standardize the spelling. c. English spelling is phonetic- -you spell the words exactly like they sound. d. English had more sounds than the 26 letters of the alphabet allowed.
In the late 1800's, the Spelling Reform Association ____. a. gained momentum b. was unsuccessful c. lost momentum d. had few followers
Andrew Carnegie was a(n) ____ who gave money to establish the Simplified Spelling Board. a. educator b. writer c. philanthropist d. librarian
If you get _____, you forget what you are doing. a. indifferent b. carried away c. shed d. evolved
When someone describes a situation as ongoing , it is one which _____. a. will begin soon b. is difficult c. hasn’t stopped yet d. will end soon
The voters were suspicious of the politician at the _____ of his career, but he earned their trust. a. fanatic b. end c. magnet d. onset
Noah Webster was known for his ____ about correct, standardized English spelling. a. fanaticism b. philanthropy c. fascination d. indifference
The Internet began ____. a. as a business b. when personal computers became popular c. as a defense project d. when the microchip was invented
The first international Internet connections went to ____. a. England and France b. Norway and Sweden c. Italy and France d. England and Norway
From 1989 to 1994, Internet use ____. a. remained the same b. increased to 2.2 million users c. decreased to 500,000 users d. increased to one million users
By 1995, most Internet support came from ____. a. business and advertising b. telephone companies c. the Defense Department d. the U.S. Congress
The Rand Institute developed a system ____. a. that anyone could use b. that created e-mail c. that connected university supercomputers d. that had one central control
Foul air is _____. a. fast-moving b. warm c. healthy d. unpleasant
If something is ventilated, it _____. a. has air moving through it b. is made of wood c. has a strong roof d. uses glass windows
An word or expression which means the same as inspiration is _____. a. good health b. good idea c. unusual food d. mixture
Fowl describes a certain group of _____. a. birds b. meats c. fishes d. vegetables
Which material did early Norse carpenters not use? a. leather b. wood c. straw d. metal
Early Norse houses usually had _____. a. a hole in the roof b. doors with iron hinges c. stone doors d. leather windows
Magpies do not collect _____. a. eggs b. feathers c. glass d. string
In the nineteenth century rich sportsmen _____. a. hired more grooms b. trimmed their horses tails themselves c. sold their horses d. wore their hair in bangs
The first English Dictionary was written by Andrew Carnegie.
The phonographic alphabet system that impressed the writer Mark Twain, used symbols to represent words.
Over time, many English words have shed useless letters . In this sentence, the word shed means added .
A process essay describes events in the order they happened over time.
When writing an historical or narrative piece, the body paragraphs of a process essay are divided into major time periods.
The expressions first, second, and third are called interrupters.
The word since indicates a period of time from the beginning of an event to the present.
The thesis statement for a process essay that is historical should name the process and indicate chronological order with the words evolved or developed .
An offense is something that is against the law.
When a species of animal evolves, it remains the same for hundreds of years.
A liberal person believes in having a lot of strict rules.
The ancient Celtic language contained many French words.
The first printing press appeared in England in the 15 th century.
“Were” and “wair” were early English spellings of the word where.
The modern word bangs comes from the name of a food.
A conglomeration contains a lot of different parts.
Someone with little money lives an austere life.
A groom works with horses.
A shorthanded crew has more than enough workers to do a job.
The ancient word for window meant wind eye .
The word pie came from the name of a bird.
The first pies often contained vegetables and eggs.
Horses had their hair in bangs before women did.
The word window originally came from the Irish language.
What is the writer's purpose in this essay?
What time order words are used in the essay?
How does the writer show the process of development?
